turns.content: Can you provide examples of specific changes or updates that Ubisoft made based on player feedback?

Yes, here are a few examples of specific changes or updates that Ubisoft made based on player feedback:

1. Assassin's Creed Odyssey - In response to complaints about the game's level gating system, Ubisoft released a patch that allowed players to adjust the level scaling, making it easier to explore the game's open world.

2. Rainbow Six Siege - After receiving feedback from players that some of the game's operators were underpowered, Ubisoft released a patch that rebalanced the game's characters to make them more even.

3. The Division 2 - Following player complaints that the game's loot system was too punishing, Ubisoft updated the game to increase the amount of high-quality gear drops.

4. Ghost Recon Wildlands - Ubisoft added the option to turn off the game's AI squadmates in response to player requests for a more immersive experience.

5. Far Cry 5 - In response to criticism that the game's story was too linear, Ubisoft released a patch that added new gameplay elements, including the ability to fish and hunt, that allowed players to explore the game world more freely.
